request.description:
Returns transactions matching the search parameters.
  

### Parameters

Query string parameters -

*   `chain` -`string` Filter by chain ID.
*   `type` - `string` Filter by transaction type. Separate multiple values by comma.
*   `start_time` - `string` Search range start time.
*   `end_time` - `string` Search range end time.
*   `start_height` - `string` Search range start block height (if applicable).
*   `block_hash` - `string` Filter by block hash (if applicable).
*   `memo` - `string` Filter by memo text field.
*   `address` - `string` Filter by account address. Separate multiple values by comma.
*   `asset` - `string` Filter by asset ID.
*   `page` - `integer` Results page.
    

### Results

Returns transaction details based on the given parameters.

* * *

request.description:
Returns transaction details for a given transaction hash.
    

### Parameters

Query string parameters -

- `/transactions/{hash}` - Pass the transaction hash in the request URL.   
 
### Results

Returns transaction details for the given transaction hash.

* * *

request.description:
Returns transactions matching the search parameters.

### Parameters

Query string parameters -

*   `block_hash` - `string` Filter by block hash.
*   `block_height` - `string` Filter by block height.
*   `sender` - Account which sent the transaction.
*   `receiver` - Account which was the transaction recipient.
*   `start_date` - `string` Search range start time.
*   `end_date` - `string` Search range end time.
*   `start_height` - `string` Search range start time.
*   `end_height` - `string` Search range end time.
*   `limit` - Limit results. Max is 100.
    

### Results

Returns transaction details.

response.name: /transactions

request.description:
Returns transaction details for a given transaction hash.
    
### Parameters

Query string parameters -

- `/transactions/{hash}` - Pass the transaction hash in the request URL.   

### Results

Returns transaction details for the given transaction hash.

response.name: /transactions/{hash}

request.description:
Transaction Search allows users to filter and query by account, event type, and date range.

### Parameters

*   `network` - `string` - Network identifier to search in. In this case, `polkadot`.
*   `account` - `array` - The account identifier to look for. This searches for all account IDs which exist inside transaction events.
*   `after_height` - `integer` - Gets all transactions bigger than given height. Has to be greater than `before_height`
*   `after_time` - `string` - The time of transaction (if not given by chain API, the same as block)
*   `before_height` - `integer` - Gets all transactions lower than given height. Has to be lesser than `after_height`
*   `before_time` - `string` - The time of transaction (if not given by the chain API, the same as block)
*   `block_hash` - `string` - The hash of block to get transaction from
*   `chain_ids` - `array` - ChainID to search in. In this case, `mainnet`
*   `epoch` - `string` - Epoch the transaction occurred in
*   `hash` - `string` - The hash of the transaction
*   `end_height` - `integer` - Height of the transactions to get
*   `limit` - `integer` - Limit how many transaction records to get in one request (default: 100, maximum: 1000)
*   `memo` - `string` - Sets full text search for memo field
*   `offset` - `integer` - Offset the next X number of records
*   `receiver` - `array` - Looks for transactions that include given account IDs
*   `sender` - `array` - Looks for transactions that include given account IDs
*   `type` - `array` - The list of types of transaction events.
*   `with_raw` - `boolean` - Include `base64` raw transaction data in search response. Defaults to `false`.
*   `with_raw_log` - `boolean` - Include `base64` raw events from search response. Defaults to `false`.
    
### Results

Returns the transaction details based on the given parameters.

Transaction Search allows users to filter and query by account, event type, and date range.

### Parameters

*   `network` - `string` - Network identifier to search in. In this case, `polkadot`.
*   `account` - `array` - The account identifier to look for. This searches for all account IDs which exist inside transaction events.
*   `after_height` - `integer` - Gets all transactions bigger than given height. Has to be greater than `before_height`
*   `after_time` - `string` - The time of transaction (if not given by chain API, the same as block)
*   `before_height` - `integer` - Gets all transactions lower than given height. Has to be lesser than `after_height`
*   `before_time` - `string` - The time of transaction (if not given by the chain API, the same as block)
*   `block_hash` - `string` - The hash of block to get transaction from
*   `chain_ids` - `array` - ChainID to search in. In this case, `mainnet`
*   `epoch` - `string` - Epoch the transaction occurred in
*   `hash` - `string` - The hash of the transaction
*   `end_height` - `integer` - Height of the transactions to get
*   `limit` - `integer` - Limit how many transaction records to get in one request (default: 100, maximum: 1000)
*   `memo` - `string` - Sets full text search for memo field
*   `offset` - `integer` - Offset the next X number of records
*   `receiver` - `array` - Looks for transactions that include given account IDs
*   `sender` - `array` - Looks for transactions that include given account IDs
*   `type` - `array` - The list of types of transaction events (see below for full list of parameters)
*   `with_raw` - `boolean` - Include `base64` raw transaction data in search response. Defaults to `false`.
*   `with_raw_log` - `boolean` - Include `base64` raw events from search response. Defaults to `false`.
   

### Results

Returns the transaction details based on the given parameters.

Transaction Search allows users to filter and query by account, transaction type, and date range. Users can also search by memo field and logs.

### Parameters

*   `network` - `string` - Network identifier to search in. In this case, `polkadot`.
*   `account` - `array` - The account identifier to look for. This searches for all account IDs which exist inside transaction events.
*   `after_height` - `integer` - Gets all transactions bigger than given height. Has to be greater than `before_height`
*   `after_time` - `string` - The time of transaction (if not given by chain API, the same as block)
*   `before_height` - `integer` - Gets all transactions lower than given height. Has to be lesser than `after_height`
*   `before_time` - `string` - The time of transaction (if not given by the chain API, the same as block)
*   `block_hash` - `string` - The hash of block to get transaction from
*   `chain_ids` - `array` - ChainID to search in. In this case, `mainnet`
*   `epoch` - `string` - Epoch the transaction occurred in
*   `hash` - `string` - The hash of the transaction
*   `end_height` - `integer` - Height of the transactions to get
*   `limit` - `integer` - Limit how many transaction records to get in one request (default: 100, maximum: 1000)
*   `memo` - `string` - Sets full text search for memo field
*   `offset` - `integer` - Offset the next X number of records
*   `receiver` - `array` - Looks for transactions that include given account IDs
*   `sender` - `array` - Looks for transactions that include given account IDs
*   `type` - `array` - The list of types of transaction events (see below for full list of parameters)
*   `with_raw` - `boolean` - Include `base64` raw transaction data in search response. Defaults to `false`.
*   `with_raw_log` - `boolean` - Include `base64` raw events from search response. Defaults to `false`.

### Modules and Transaction Types

- `bank` : `multisend`, `send`
- `crisis` : `verify_invariant`
- `distribution` : `withdraw_validator_commission`, `set_withdraw_address`, `withdraw_delegator_reward`, `fund_community_pool`
- `evidence` : `submit_evidence`
- `gov` : `deposit`, `vote`, `submit_proposal`
- `slashing` : `unjail`
- `staking` : `begin_unbonding`, `edit_validator`, `create_validator`, `delegate`, `begin_redelegate`
- `internal` : `error`
    
### Results

In response you get the transaction details based on the passed parameters.
